intro: Lightfootia calcarea, commonly known as the limestone rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub that typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are small, succulent, and often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Lightfootia calcarea is well adapted to arid conditions and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
